|Hail|
あられ Hail
|
|[Ability](/wiki/Ability) [Hail](/wiki/Hail_(move)) [Max Hailstorm](/wiki/Max_Hailstorm_(move)) [Snow Warning](/wiki/Snow_Warning_(Ability))
Hail (Japanese: あられ Hail) is a type of
[weather](/wiki/Weather) introduced in battle in [Generation III](/wiki/Generation_III). It was introduced in the overworld in [Generation IV](/wiki/Generation_IV).
It will last for five turns if created using
[Snow Warning](/wiki/Snow_Warning_(Ability)) ( [Generation VI](/wiki/Generation_VI) onward) or [Hail](/wiki/Hail_(move)), or eight, if created by a Pokémon holding an [Icy Rock](/wiki/Icy_Rock). If created using Snow Warning (prior to Generation VI) or encountered in the overworld, it will last until replaced.
In
[Pokémon Sword and Shield](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Sword_and_Shield), [Max Hailstorm](/wiki/Max_Hailstorm_(move)) causes a hailstorm after dealing damage.
Hail does not exist in
[Pokémon Legends: Arceus](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Legends:_Arceus) and [Generation IX](/wiki/Generation_IX), as it has been replaced by [snow](/wiki/Snow).

In
[Galar](/wiki/Galar), there are different types of weather occurring in the [Wild Area](/wiki/Wild_Area) and the [Crown Tundra](/wiki/Crown_Tundra). The type of weather will affect which wild Pokémon appear in the area. During Snow and Blizzard overworld weather, the in-battle weather condition will be Hail. There are nine types of weather in the Wild Area. It is the only weather condition to not occur in the [Isle of Armor](/wiki/Isle_of_Armor).
For the Blizzard overworld weather to occur in the Wild Area, there is a prerequisite to have first visited Hammerlocke.

Additionally, in the following dungeons,
[Pokémon](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon) with [Snow Warning](/wiki/Snow_Warning_(Ability)) can spawn, causing hail to occur and possibly override existing weather:
- In
[Explorers](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Mystery_Dungeon:_Explorers_of_Time_and_Darkness) [series](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Mystery_Dungeon:_Explorers_of_Sky): [Snover](/wiki/Snover_(Pok%C3%A9mon))in [Crevice Cave](/wiki/Crevice_Cave) [Abomasnow](/wiki/Abomasnow_(Pok%C3%A9mon))in [Hidden Land](/wiki/Hidden_Land), floors 20-24 of [Zero Isle South](/wiki/Zero_Isle_South), floors 20-24 of [Destiny Tower](/wiki/Destiny_Tower_(Explorers_of_Sky))and in [Oblivion Forest](/wiki/Oblivion_Forest)
-
Effects
In battle
- At the end of each turn, damages each Pokémon for 1/16 of its maximum HP, unless it is
[Ice-type](/wiki/Ice_(type)); has one of the Abilities [Ice Body](/wiki/Ice_Body_(Ability)), [Snow Cloak](/wiki/Snow_Cloak_(Ability)), [Magic Guard](/wiki/Magic_Guard_(Ability)), or [Overcoat](/wiki/Overcoat_(Ability)); or is holding [Safety Goggles](/wiki/Safety_Goggles).
- Activates the following
[Abilities](/wiki/Ability): [Forecast](/wiki/Forecast_(Ability)), [Ice Body](/wiki/Ice_Body_(Ability)), [Snow Cloak](/wiki/Snow_Cloak_(Ability)), and [Slush Rush](/wiki/Slush_Rush_(Ability)). Additionally, [Ice Face](/wiki/Ice_Face_(Ability))turns [Eiscue](/wiki/Eiscue_(Pok%C3%A9mon))from its Noice Face form to its Ice Face form.
- Causes Forecast to change
[Castform](/wiki/Castform_(Pok%C3%A9mon))to its [Snowy Form](/wiki/List_of_Pok%C3%A9mon_with_form_differences#Castform).
- Causes Forecast to change
- Changes
[Weather Ball](/wiki/Weather_Ball_(move))to an [Ice-type](/wiki/Ice_(type))move and doubles its power.
- From
[Generation IV](/wiki/Generation_IV)onward, allows [Blizzard](/wiki/Blizzard_(move))to bypass accuracy check.
- In
[Pokémon Diamond and Pearl](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Diamond_and_Pearl_Versions), allows [Blizzard](/wiki/Blizzard_(move))to hit through [Protect](/wiki/Protect_(move))and [Detect](/wiki/Detect_(move))30% of the time.
- In
- Halves the power of
[Solar Beam](/wiki/Solar_Beam_(move))and [Solar Blade](/wiki/Solar_Blade_(move)).
- Causes
[Moonlight](/wiki/Moonlight_(move)), [Synthesis](/wiki/Synthesis_(move)), and [Morning Sun](/wiki/Morning_Sun_(move))to recover ¼ of the user's maximum [HP](/wiki/Stat#HP).
- Allows
[Aurora Veil](/wiki/Aurora_Veil_(move))to be used, though the effect lingers even after Hail ends.
Outside of battle
[Sweet Scent](/wiki/Sweet_Scent_(move)) and [Honey](/wiki/Honey) will fail if it is hailing in the area.
Variations
Light snow
Snow falls slowly to the ground. It is in
[Snowpoint City](/wiki/Snowpoint_City), in occasionn on [Acuity Lakefront](/wiki/Acuity_Lakefront) and [Route 216](/wiki/Route_216) on January 12 in Generation IV. In [Generation V](/wiki/Generation_V), it is referred to as "Snowy" by the gate's bulletin and is found on many days during [winter](/wiki/Season_(mechanic)) in all places snow falls. In [Generation VI](/wiki/Generation_VI), it is occasionally found in [Dendemille Town](/wiki/Dendemille_Town) and Anistar City, and sometimes falls outside [Frost Cavern](/wiki/Frost_Cavern) in the day after rescuing [Abomasnow](/wiki/Abomasnow_(Pok%C3%A9mon)). No battles take place outside any buildings in Snowpoint City, so it is unclear if any weather is assumed in battle in Generation IV. In Generation V, however, light snow does not cause hail in battle, while in Generation IV and VI, it does.
Hailstorm
Precipitate falls more quickly and heavily, falling diagonally from one of the top corners of the screen, leaving the impression that it is being carried by strong winds, and sometimes appears to be mixed with hail. In Generation IV, it is found on
[Route 216](/wiki/Sinnoh_Route_216), [Acuity Lakefront](/wiki/Acuity_Lakefront), and at the summit of [Mt. Silver](/wiki/Mt._Silver). In Generation V, it is referred to as "Hail" by the gate's bulletin and is found on some days during the winter in [Driftveil City](/wiki/Driftveil_City), [Cold Storage](/wiki/Cold_Storage) [BW](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Black_and_White_Versions), [Route 6](/wiki/Unova_Route_6), [Mistralton City](/wiki/Mistralton_City), [Route 7](/wiki/Unova_Route_7), and [Twist Mountain](/wiki/Twist_Mountain). In Generation VI, there is always a hailstorm on [Route 17](/wiki/Kalos_Route_17), as well as sometimes outside [Frost Cavern](/wiki/Frost_Cavern), although only before rescuing [Abomasnow](/wiki/Abomasnow_(Pok%C3%A9mon)).
Blizzard
Snow whips around, making it difficult to see. In Generation IV, it is found on
[Route 217](/wiki/Sinnoh_Route_217), and less often on [Route 216](/wiki/Sinnoh_Route_216). In Generation V, it is only found occasionally in [Icirrus City](/wiki/Icirrus_City), [Dragonspiral Tower](/wiki/Dragonspiral_Tower), and [Route 8](/wiki/Unova_Route_8) in the winter.

In the
[Pokémon Adventures](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Adventures) manga, in addition to the aforementioned move and Ability, hail also appeared at the [Battle Arcade](/wiki/Battle_Arcade) as a result of the game board in [Interrupting Ivysaur](/wiki/PS422).

Trivia
- Despite being referred to as "
hail" in the games, the way it is depicted is more similar to ice pellets. While hail cannot occur during a snowstorm or in snowy areas in the real world, ice pellets can.
- In real life, hail most commonly occurs in winter in mild climates. In
[Pokémon Black, White](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Black_and_White_Versions), [Black 2, and White 2](/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Black_and_White_Versions_2), just like in real life, hail only occurs in areas with a warmer climate (e.g. [Driftveil City](/wiki/Driftveil_City)); colder climates (e.g. [Icirrus City](/wiki/Icirrus_City), [Dragonspiral Tower](/wiki/Dragonspiral_Tower)and [Route 8](/wiki/Unova_Route_8)) instead have light snow or blizzards.
- In real life, hail most commonly occurs in winter in mild climates. In
- An unused hail quote appears within the code of the games.
